On Monday 21 February 2005 21:59, nyhockeyfan1994 wrote:
> Hello All,
>
> I have used JUnit before, however I have been unable to figure out how
> to test methods that don't have a return value. How do you test those
> types of methods? Do all methods have to return a value to be able to
> develop a test for it?

If a method doesn't return a value, it must side-effect something.
(Or it mustn't.) Check that the side-effects have happened.

To take a random example, a Jena PrefixMapping has a method

    pm.setNsPrefix( String prefix, String uri )

In fact it does return a result - itself - and that result is 
checked for, but the *important* effect is that the mapping
from prefixes to URIs changes, so we check that after

    pm.setNsPrefix( "spoo", "some:uriThing" )

then
    pm.getNsPrefixURI( "spoo" ) = "some:uriThing"

(and various other things too).

-- 
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
